title: Contextual reply (database and protocol parts; #594)
message:
Contextual reply (database and protocol parts; #594)

The referenced message is not stored in our database, but is rather
referenced through the message id received in the forwarded stanza.
This is to save space and avoid storing too much stuff in our database,
but also to keep consistency. This has the side effect of not being
able to show the original message in a reply if it is deleted.

Signed-off-by: Daniele Ricci <daniele@casaricci.it>

title: Acquire a wake lock for each sent message/receipt
message:
Acquire a wake lock for each sent message/receipt

There were cases where the OS didn't give enough time to confirm a
message because the device went back to sleep. This will ensure
that outgoing messages and receipts are correctly received by
the server.

Thanks to @webratte for helping me debugging this.

Signed-off-by: Daniele Ricci <daniele@casaricci.it>

title: Account transfer between devices now working
message:
Account transfer between devices now working

Although it's a bit tricky because the actual work
is done in NumberValidation, meaning that if it fails,
form data in ImportDeviceActivity will be lost.
So next step would be to retrieve the private key from
ImportDeviceActivity and pass it on via activity result
to NumberValidation.

title: Workaround for osmdroid/osmdroid#633
message:
Workaround for osmdroid/osmdroid#633

Apparently, ConnectivityManager.requestRouteToHost was *removed* from
the source code in API level 26. This might cause problems on Android O,
and adding a dontwarn to ProGuard isn't really the ideal solution.

Signed-off-by: Daniele Ricci <daniele.athome@gmail.com>

title: Handle Argentinian special cases (fix #917)
message:
Handle Argentinian special cases (fix #917)

Forcibly adding a 9 between country code and national number.
There is no other way of conforming with Argentinian rules and
produce a unique format in a consistent way. Both formats with
or without the 9 are valid for libphonenumber.

title: add default preference; removed hardcoded boolean

title: Remove view holders for the countries list
message:
Remove view holders for the countries list

They are not needed now. Memory allocations removal improves performance
and decreases memory consumption.

title: Remove flags images and items layouts
message: Remove flags images and items layouts

title: Use simple item layouts for the countries list
message:
Use simple item layouts for the countries list

Remove coutries flags.

1. Material design does not encourage the use of colorful icons in menus.
   See https://material.google.com/components/menus.html
2. Flags are not scaled properly since they are in the nodpi category.
3. They consume a plenty of memory. On Android 2.3.7 with 512 MB of RAM
   it was impossible to pass the registration screen because Kontalk
   got OutOfMemoryError while scrolling the countries list. Now there are
   still a lot of GC invocations but it does not crash anymore.

title: Clarify use of some menu entries in groups
message:
Clarify use of some menu entries in groups

"Delete chat history" will only delete the messages
"Leave group" will only leave the group and keep the messages

All delete/leave group confirmation dialogs have a check box to also
delete messages or leave the group.

message:

messages. Add drawables for those balloons and remove bottom paddings
from the "starting" balloons.

Other themes are intact.

Nothing changes for Holo devices: the very same drawables will be
provided by the system.

On Lollipop and later devices fast scroll will be Material-themed,
which is more consistent with current Kontalk design.

title: Fix search again (#752)
message:
Fix search again (#752)

Seems that pointing to the the SearchActivity with a relative package
doesn't work for the debug flavour because of the package name.
The previous commit doesn't fix this bug, however it's ok because search
should only be initiated from within the main activity.

Ref: https://github.com/android/platform_frameworks_base/blob/kitkat-mr1-release/services/java/com/android/server/search/Searchables.java#L162

Signed-off-by: Daniele Ricci <daniele.athome@gmail.com>

title: Fix message search (fix #752)
message:
Fix message search (fix #752)

SearchManager.getSearchableInfo() always returning null becase meta-data
for default_searchable was defined outside the Activity block.
I don't know it could have worked all this time, but whatever...

title: Remove deprecated android:autoText and android:capitalize
message:
Remove deprecated android:autoText and android:capitalize

EmojiconEditText already sets required properties via android:inputType.

title: Use sp instead of dp for text
message:
Use sp instead of dp for text

Scale-independent pixels should be used for text views because they
consider user font size setting.

    https://developer.android.com/guide/practices/screens_support.html

title: Avoid hardcoded text colors
message:
Avoid hardcoded text colors

Use constants instead.

title: Remove layout-v11/composer_bar.xml
message:
Remove layout-v11/composer_bar.xml

It's not needed because now it looks the same as layout/composer_bar.xml.

title: Modernize composer bar on Gingerbread
message:
Modernize composer bar on Gingerbread

Make it look the same as on Honeycomb+ devices: use AppCompat styles and
paddings from layout-v11/composer_bar.xml.

Besides, we don't support account name switch yet.

title: Fix adaptive ping issue
message:
Fix adaptive ping issue

Fixed an issue that was causing the adaptive ping algorithm to not consider
the backoff interval for trying to increase the ping interval.
Now the adaptive ping manager keeps track of the ping streak (i.e. how much
time we have been having successful pings) and uses it to determine how and
when try an increase of the ping interval.

Signed-off-by: Daniele Ricci <daniele.athome@gmail.com>

title: Invalidate contact cache when changes are made (close #574)
message:
Invalidate contact cache when changes are made (close #574)

As I suspected, using a specific ContentObserver for each contact doesn't work.
The system always fires global change notifications thereby rendering the
observers useless. I'll be using a single observer that invalidates the whole
cache - that's a shame.

Signed-off-by: Daniele Ricci <daniele.athome@gmail.com>

title: Fix some syncer issues (fix #554)
message:
Fix some syncer issues (fix #554)

Two issues were fixed.

1. reusing a ContentValues object led to a unique constraint violation on the
users database
2. forcing to use the roster name if no public key was found for a contact led
to show the default roster name for it (i.e. the hash), overwriting the real
display name of the contact

Signed-off-by: Daniele Ricci <daniele.athome@gmail.com>

title: Stop message center when screen goes off if it's struggling (fix #403)
message:
Stop message center when screen goes off if it's struggling (fix #403)

Kill the message center if, when the screen goes off, it already
tried connecting without success for more than 5 times.
This will free the connection wakelock, freeing the device from
a situation that will probably not recover shortly.

Signed-off-by: Daniele Ricci <daniele.athome@gmail.com>

title: Make adaptive ping actually works and decrease min interval to 90 seconds
message:
Make adaptive ping actually works and decrease min interval to 90 seconds

Experiments on 3G/4G networks showed that below 90 seconds
connection remains stable. Just passing the 90 seconds threshold,
the connection is quietly destroyed by the carrier.

There are still some glitches in this adaptive algorithm (namely:
learning stickness, that is, the algorithm tends to forget soon
what was the best value, I'll have to work on that).

Signed-off-by: Daniele Ricci <daniele.athome@gmail.com>

title: Optimize adaptive ping
message:
Optimize adaptive ping

The adaptive ping manager will now wait for at least the full interval of the
next ping before incrementing back that interval after a success. This way,
the ping interval will stay fixed until the device can hold more.

title: Workaround preference for external contacts provider (fix #377)
message:
Workaround preference for external contacts provider (fix #377)

A combined bug of Android and DAVDroid makes all contacts not
belonging to at least 2 groups not being seen by Kontalk sync
because of filtering on IN_VISIBLE_GROUP=1. This preference, if
enabled, will remove that filter and will include all contacts.

title: Send bridge client certificate also when registering
message:
Send bridge client certificate also when registering

An initial bridge certificate is created and sent during
TLS handshake on registration so the server can certify that
the public key is being signed is owned by the client.
This also means that public key inside XMPP validation form
will not be sent anymore.

to Tigase. This trick was put in place in order to wait for
the async account removal from Android account manager.

title: DownloadService: use database ID instead of server ID
message:
DownloadService: use database ID instead of server ID

Using the server ID will make the DownloadService update
the local_uri for all messages with that server ID. This
led to updating the outgoing message too if the message
was sent to ourselves (I know, silly case, yet it's a bug)

Signed-off-by: Daniele Ricci <daniele.athome@gmail.com>

Import key pair process (preference not active yet)

This is a very basic and ugly import key pair process which uses the same
procedure of key regeneration, but instead it sends the imported key to the
server, which will accept it as valid.
Actual user interaction is still missing, it will be implemented soon.
After that, importing will be implemented also for the registration phase.

title: Release wake lock as soon as we are authenticated
message:
Release wake lock as soon as we are authenticated

Trying to address the problems pointed out in issue #143. The main problem here is wake locks are too long-lived or too much. We can't
lower the number of wake locks, but we can do something to make them
shorter. This, however, puts the app in danger of losing the connection to the server when the device is put on standby.

Signed-off-by: Daniele Ricci <daniele.athome@gmail.com>

title: Use Threads.request for marking conversations with pending invitation
message:
Use Threads.request for marking conversations with pending invitation

Conversation will always retain its original data from the latest
message; the request flag will determine if there is a pending
subscription request. The accept/block dialog will also have another
button to ignore the request and go straight to the conversation.

title: Sending "big" files is back again :)
message:
Sending "big" files is back again :)

PostMessageRequest pack is prepared in-memory with the entire content of
the file being sent. This is only a temporary fix for this and actually
the protobuf library should be changed to behave in a more "streamed"
fashion.
Next change will be limiting the size of a message to a limit imposed
by server configuration (via serverinfo).

title: Delay notifications for new incoming message for 3 seconds
message:
Delay notifications for new incoming message for 3 seconds

That will give time to the markAsRead thread to
carry out its task, so the notification doesn't
get fired twice.
